pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:0.5.eng: 55. The training rule on with food

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū kokanade pāsāde sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggaṇhanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.2.eng: the monks in the Kokanada stilt house were receiving the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessanti, seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics receive drinking-water vessels with hands soiled with food? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessantī”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggaṇhantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.11.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.14.1.pli: “Na sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggahessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.14.1.eng: ‘“I will not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.15.eng: One should not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.16.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sāmisena hatthena pānīyathālakaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.16.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.22.eng: if he receives it with the intention of washing it or having it washed;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.25.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:1.26.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:0.5.eng: 56. The training rule on containing rice

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū kokanade pāsāde sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.2.eng: the monks in the Kokanada stilt house were discarding their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍessanti, seyyathāpi gihī kāmabhogino”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics discard their bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍessantī”ti …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍentī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.11.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.14.1.pli: “Na sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.14.1.eng: ‘“I will not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in inhabited areas,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.15.eng: One should not discard bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.16.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca sasitthakaṃ pattadhovanaṃ antaraghare chaḍḍeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.16.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, discards bowl-washing water containing rice in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.22.pli: uddharitvā vā bhinditvā vā paṭiggahe vā nīharitvā vā chaḍḍeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.22.eng: if he discards it after removing the rice, after breaking it up, into a container, or after taking it outside;

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.25.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk56:1.26.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:0.5.eng: 57. The training rule on holding a sunshade

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū chattapāṇissa dhammaṃ desenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a sunshade.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū chattapāṇissa dhammaṃ desessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.4.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six give teachings to people holding a sunshade?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, chattapāṇissa dhammaṃ desethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, chattapāṇissa dhammaṃ desessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.8.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.11.1.eng: ‘“I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.12.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:1.12.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū chattapāṇissa gilānassa dhammaṃ desetuṃ kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not give teachings to sick people holding a sunshade.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā chattapāṇissa gilānassa dhammaṃ na desessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.3.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics not give teachings to someone who’s sick holding a sunshade?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.6.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.7.eng: “Monks, I allow you to give a teaching to someone who’s sick holding a sunshade.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.8.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.8.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.9.1.pli: “Na chattapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.9.1.eng: ‘“I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.11.pli: tīṇi chattāni— setacchattaṃ, kilañjacchattaṃ, paṇṇacchattaṃ maṇḍalabaddhaṃ salākabaddhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.11.eng: there are three kinds of sunshades: the white sunshade, the reed sunshade, the leaf sunshade. They are bound at the rim and bound at the ribs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.11.comm: Sp 2.634: Maṇḍalabaddhaṁ salākabaddhanti idaṁ pana tiṇṇampi chattānaṁ pañjaradassanatthaṁ vuttaṁ. Tāni hi maṇḍalabaddhāni ceva honti salākabaddhāni ca. “Maṇḍalabaddhaṁ salākabaddhan: this is said for the purpose of showing the frame of the three sunshades. For they are bound at the rim (maṇḍalabaddha) and bound at the ribs (salākabaddha).”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.13.pli: buddhabhāsito sāvakabhāsito isibhāsito devatābhāsito atthūpasañhito dhammūpasañhito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.13.eng: what has been spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by disciples, what has been spoken by sages, what has been spoken by gods, what is connected with what is beneficial, what is connected with the Teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.15.pli: padena deseti, pade pade āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.15.eng: if he teaches by the line, then for every line he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.16.eng: If he teaches by the syllable, then for every syllable he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.17.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a sunshade who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.18.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca chattapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.18.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a sunshade who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.21.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk57:2.22.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:0.5.eng: 58. The training rule on holding a staff

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū daṇḍapāṇissa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding staffs. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.3.1.pli: “Na daṇḍapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.5.comm: Majjhimassa purisassa catuhattho daṇḍo, “It is a stick of four forearms of a man of average height.” For a discussion of the hattha, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.6.eng: What is longer than that is not a staff, nor what is shorter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.7.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a staff who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.8.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca daṇḍapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.8.eng: If a monk out, of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a staff who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk58:1.12.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:0.5.eng: 59. The training rule on holding a knife

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū satthapāṇissa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding knives. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.3.1.pli: “Na satthapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a knife who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.5.eng: a weapon with a single-edged or double-edged blade.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.5.comm: For paharaṇaṁ see SED, sv. praharaṇa.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.6.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a knife who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.7.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca satthapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.7.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a knife who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.11.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.4.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.5.eng: 6. The second training rule on well-restrained

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū hatthampi pādampi kīḷāpentā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while sitting in inhabited areas. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will be well-restrained while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.4.eng: One should be well-restrained while sitting in an inhabited area.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca hatthaṃ vā pādaṃ vā kīḷāpento antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands or feet while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.13.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:0.5.eng: 60. The training rule on holding a weapon

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū āvudhapāṇissa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding weapons. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.3.1.pli: “Na āvudhapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.6.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone holding a weapon who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.7.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca āvudhapāṇissa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.7.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone holding a weapon who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.11.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk60:1.12.eng: The sixth subchapter on slurping is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pādukāruḷhassa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing shoes. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.3.1.pli: “Na pādukāruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.4.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing shoes who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is not sick and who is standing on his shoes, whose shoes are fastened, or whose shoes are loose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.5.comm: Sp 2.638: Akkantassāti chattadaṇḍake aṅgulantaraṁ appavesetvā kevalaṁ pādukaṁ akkamitvā ṭhitassa. Paṭimukkassāti paṭimuñcitvā ṭhitassa. Upāhanāyapi eseva nayo. Omukkoti panettha paṇhikabaddhaṁ omuñcitvā ṭhito vuccati, “Akkantassa: not having entered the toes into the chattadaṇḍaka, he stands on top of the entire shoe. Paṭimukkassa: he stands after fastening. But here, standing after loosening the heel strap, it is called omukka.” It is not clear what a chattadaṇḍaka, literally, “a sunshade rib”, means in this context. Perhaps it refers to the thong that goes between the toes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk61:1.9.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upāhanāruḷhassa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing sandals. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.3.1.pli: “Na upāhanāruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.4.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.5.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.5.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone who is not sick and who is standing on sandals, whose sandals are fastened, or whose sandals are loose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:1.9.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yānagatassa dhammaṃ desenti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people in vehicles. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.3.1.pli: “Na yānagatassa agilānassa dhammaṃ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.3.1.eng: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.5.pli: vayhaṃ ratho sakaṭaṃ sandamānikā sivikā pāṭaṅkī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.5.eng: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot, a palanquin, a litter.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.6.eng: One should not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.7.pli: Yo anādariyaṃ paṭicca yānagatassa agilānassa dhammaṃ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.7.eng: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone in a vehicle who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.11.eng: The third training rule is finished.
